summary: The 'Utilize Standards for All Act' (USA Act) aims to amend the Research and Development, Competition, and Innovation Act. It primarily focuses on the role of the Director of the National Institute of Standards and Technology (NIST) in international standards development. The bill mandates the Director to promote principles of openness, transparency, due process, appeals, and consensus. It also emphasizes the importance of private sector-led voluntary consensus standards, strengthening public-private partnerships, and ensuring federal agency coordination on standards for emerging technologies to enhance US economic competitiveness and global market access.
